advice.quote: To write well, express yourself like the common people, but think like a wise man.

haiku.poem: No one travels. Along this way but I, This autumn evening.

book_quote.paragraph: You often complain to me that people “don't understand” you. But even Goethe and Newton made no such complaints. Christ did, true, but he was talking about his doctrine, not his ego. People understand you all too well. If you don't understand yourself, then it's nobody else's fault.
book_quote.author: Anton Chekhov
book_quote.book: from a letter to his brother Nikolay Pavlovich Chekhov

advice.quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.

haiku.poem: An old silent pond. A frog jumps into the pond - Splash! Silence again.

book3.author: Italo Calvino
book3.name: If on a winter's night a traveler

advice.quote: Until we have begun to go without them, we fail to realize how unnecessary many things are. We've been using them not because we needed them but because we had them.

haiku.poem: The light of a candle is transferred to another candle - Spring twilight.

advice.quote: The things you think about determine the quality of your mind.

haiku.poem: I write, erase, rewrite, erase again, and then a poppy blooms.

book3.author: Henri Bergson
book3.name: Laughter: an essay on the meaning of the comic

advice.quote: It is not the man who has too little that is poor, but the one who hankers after more.

haiku.poem: Over the wintry forest, winds howl in rage with no leaves to blow.

book1.author: Pierre Bayard
book1.name: How to talk about books you haven't read

advice.quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.

haiku.poem: Love between us is speech and breath. Loving you is a long river running.

advice.quote: The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.

haiku.poem: Picking autumn plums. My wrinkled hands once again grow fragrant.

masterpiece.artwork: The Virgin and Child with Saint Anne

advice.quote: Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.

haiku.poem: These useless dreams, alas! Over fields of wilted grass winds whisper as they pass.

advice.quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.

haiku.poem: Whistle on, twilight whippoorwill, solemn evangelist of loneliness.

advice.quote: If anyone tells you that a certain person speaks ill of you, do not make excuses about what is said of you but answer, 'He was ignorant of my other faults, else he would not have mentioned these alone.'

haiku.poem: All evening the softest sound - the cadence of the white camellia petals falling.

advice.quote: Man is a mystery. It needs to be unravelled, and if you spend your whole life unravelling it, don't say that you've wasted time. I am studying that mystery because I want to be a human being.

haiku.poem: The calm, cool face of the river asked me for a kiss.

advice.quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.

haiku.poem: I had thought to pluck the flower of forgetfulness only to find it already blossoming in his heart.

advice.quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.

haiku.poem: Overtaken by darkness, I will lodge under a tree's branches; cherry blossoms will cushion me tonight.

masterpiece.artwork: The Wanderer Above The Sea Of Fog

advice.quote: The highest activity a human being can attain is learning for understanding, because to understand is to be free.

haiku.poem: Both victor and vanquished are dewdrops, flashes of lightning, as we envision this life.

masterpiece.artwork: A Lighthouse On Fire At Night

advice.quote: To write well, express yourself like the common people, but think like a wise man.

haiku.poem: Soundlessly they go, the herons passing by: arrows of snow filling the sky.

masterpiece.artwork: Lake by Moonlight with Castle on Hill

advice.quote: Death, therefore, the most awful of evils, is nothing to us, seeing that, when we are, death is not come, and, when death is come, we are not.

haiku.poem: My life was mere lunacy until the moon shone tonight.
